node.title: Judge Rejects Trump’s Bid to Keep Papers Secret in Jan. 6 Inquiry
node.description: But a Trump lawyer has signaled an intent to appeal the ruling, which raises novel issues about an ex-president’s executive privilege powers.

node.title: COP26: Obama chides China and Russia, urges support for poorer nations
node.description: Former US President Barack Obama has called for rich nations to end years of deadlock with developing countries over cash for climate change, and criticised China and Russia.

node.title: Obama addresses High Ambition Coalition countries at COP26
node.description: Explainer - New Zealand is part of a coalition pushing for more progressive climate policies in Glasgow.

node.title: Green Bay Packers, Aaron Rodgers and Allen Lazard fined for COVID violations
node.description: Aaron Rodgers tested positive for COVID-19 last week, and later revealed he was not vaccinated.

node.title: Emotion and Grit Power Kenyans in New York City Marathon
node.description: Albert Korir won the men’s division in 2:08:22, while Peres Jepchirchir won the women’s division in 2:22:39 after also winning at the Tokyo Games.

node.title: Tuvalu minister gives COP26 speech standing knee-deep in the sea
node.description: Simon Kofe wears a suit and tie at a lectern set up in the sea, speaking from what used to be dry land to draw attention to Tuvalu's struggle against rising sea levels.

node.title: Tyson Fury '50 per cent fit' for fight with Deontay Wilder
node.description: Tyson Fury was dealing with a serious injury during his heavyweight championship fight with Deontay Wilder and has since required surgery, his father John says.

node.title: Paramedic's bid to be exempt from 'morally repugnant' vax mandate struck down in court
node.description: Veteran health worker and Snowy Valleys Deputy Mayor John Larter's legal push to have part of the state's public health orders declared invalid is rejected in the Supreme Court.

node.title: Farmers need support to adjust to increase in dry conditions, reports say
node.description: Regional councils and primary sector bodies are being told they need to act now to better support farmers to grow food under increasingly dry conditions.

node.title: BNZ annual net profit rises by 74% to $1.3bn
node.description: Another major retail bank has seen its profits surge, driven by the strong economic rebound from Covid-19, high demand for mortgages and a lack of bad debts.

node.title: Fonterra continues plans to vote on future of capital structure
node.description: Dairy giant Fonterra is pressing on with plans to hold a vote on the future of its capital structure, despite not yet having government support for the proposal.

node.title: Air NZ preparing for summer holiday flights ahead of govt border restriction announcement
node.description: Air New Zealand's chief executive estimates it could take up to six weeks to prepare to fly New Zealanders to their chosen Christmas destinations, so it needs a decision on borders urgently. Audio

node.title: Aucklanders keen for move to traffic light system: 'We are ready for it'
node.description: Customers will be hesitant until the new system is in place, an Auckland cafe owner says, and he's banking on being able to welcome customers back to tables from December.

node.title: Central Otago orchards concerned they won't have enough staff this season
node.description: Some Central Otago orchards are scrambling to find enough staff with less than a month until harvest.

node.title: Tower Insurance changes flood risk pricing, reduces part of premium
node.description: Nearly 90 percent of Tower customers will have the flood risk portion of their premium reduced, at an average of $25 each.

node.title: Average residential home now worth more than $1m
node.description: The property market reached new heights last month with the average residential home value topping a million dollars for the first time. The property market reached new heights last month...

node.title: Retail reopens in Auckland: Security guards on the doors as shoppers return
node.description: It's day one of alert level 3, step 2 for the city and retailers are flinging open their doors for an expected rush of pent-up demand, while many museums, zoos and libraries are gradually re-opening.

node.title: Pistorius could be up for parole
node.description: The South African Paralympic athlete Oscar Pistorius, convicted of murdering his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp, may soon meet her parents as part of the process leading up to parole.

node.title: Lowe keen to play against All Blacks
node.description: Ireland wing James Lowe is relishing the prospect of playing against some of his closest friends in this weekend's game against his native New Zealand.

node.title: 'We're going to give it everything' - Moana Pasifika's road to Super Rugby
node.description: After 26 years of waiting, what's another couple of months?

node.title: Aaron Smith back with All Blacks
node.description: All Blacks halfback Aaron Smith will join the squad in Dublin midweek to provide injury cover.

node.title: England deny they're favourites for World Cup semi-final
node.description: England captain Eoin Morgan won't say who'll move up to partner opener Jos Buttler and dismissed suggestions his side would be "strong favourites" against New Zealand.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - Saunders in charge at Laser world champs, Sharma to captain India and Marler tests positive.

node.title: Ardern's Auckland visit: 'I'll be able to talk to the workforce'
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern will meet with workers, businesspeople and frontline health workers on her visit to Auckland tomorrow, but is not expected to be out and about in public.
